sermons.title: Acts Chapter 29
sermons.preacher_description:
Dean Taylor ( Â– Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Dean Taylor in mp3 format. Dean Taylor is the general editor of The Remnant of the Charity church movement. He has written a powerful book on non-resistance: A Change of Allegiance. His teachings on suffering and martyrdom are important for the body of Christ and we must learn again from our forefathers and how they suffered for Christ.
"Every day IÂ’m more convinced that the only thing worth putting my life into is the simple, child-like acceptance of the teachings of Jesus. I believe that Jesus meant what He said. But even more, I believe that JesusÂ’ plan for humanity is actually a great idea! Sometimes the ways and wisdom of Jesus donÂ’t make sense." - Dean Taylor

sermons.title: Book of Acts Series - Part 1 | Visitation
sermons.preacher_description:
Jim Cymbala (1949 - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Jim Cymbala in mp3 format. Brother Jim Cymbala was called into ministry without formal training in Brooklyn, New York to pastor a small gathering. God showed him the great need of prayer and depending on the work of the Holy Spirit in the ministry. God blessed and grew the brooklyn tabernacle to a large church of thousands because of this reliance.

The burden of his ministry is to show the vital need for prayer, deependence on God and that God uses the weak and lowly to build His kingdom. He has written many books including the best-selling: "Fresh Wind, Fresh Fire" and his newer book "Spirit Rising" speaking of the neglected work of the Holy Spirit in our churches these days.

sermons.title: Book of Acts Series - Part 38 | What Does God Want You To Leave?
sermons.description: Pastor Cymbala resumes his study in the book of Acts. Most believers want to grow in a greater closeness to Christ and receive greater blessings. The problem is we have to leave the place where we are.

sermons.title: Book of Acts Series - Part 39 | Finishing The Work
sermons.description: God encourages us, even when challenges look overwhelming, to trust Him and to share our testimony and the good news of Jesus Christ with others, as Paul did. Acts 22:30-23:11 & John 17:4

sermons.title: Book of Acts Series - Part 40 | The Plan
sermons.description: There are good plans and evil plans. In this teaching from Acts, Pastor Cymbala shows that without Godly plans nothing can be accomplished. Acts 23:12-24; Exod 26:30; Psalms 40:5; Proverbs 20:18, Psalms 20:4
sermons.preacher_description:
Jim Cymbala (1949 - Present)

sermons.title: Book of Acts Series - Part 41 | Accusations
sermons.description: It happened to Jesus, it happened to Paul, it happened to the Apostles and it happens today. We live in the day of accusations and false representations all of which come from the accuser of the brethren. Listen carefully to hear how we are to deal with accusations. Acts 23:23-29 & Acts 4:19-20
sermons.preacher_description:
Jim Cymbala (1949 - Present)

sermons.title: Book of Acts Series - Part 42 | He's Alive
sermons.description: The Book of Acts records the events of the early Christian Church. Paul exemplified the Christian life by showing poise under pressure because Paul lived his life in light of the cross and preached that Jesus is alive. Acts 24:10- 27; Acts 25:7-19

The burden of his ministry is to show the vital need for prayer, deependence on God and that God uses the weak and lowly to build His kingdom. He has written many books including the best-selling: "Fresh Wind, Fresh Fire" and his newer book "Spirit Rising" speaking of the neglected work of the Holy Spirit in our churches these days.

sermons.title: Book of Acts Series - Part 43 | The Most Unlikely Christian
sermons.description: In this study, we hear Paul's testimony, by God's grace and mercy, the most unlikely Christian turns out to be the greatest Christian. Be encouraged, never give up because God specializes in hopeless cases. Acts 26:1- 19

sermons.title: Did You Kill the Lord of Glory?
sermons.preacher_description:
John Piper (1946 - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker John Piper in mp3 format. is a Calvinistic Baptist Christian preacher and author currently serving as Pastor for Preaching and Vision of Bethlehem Baptist Church in Minneapolis, Minnesota. His books include ECPA Christian Book Award winners Spectacular Sins, What Jesus Demands from the World, Pierced by the Word, and God's Passion for His Glory, and bestsellers Don't Waste Your Life and The Passion of Jesus Christ. The evangelical organization Desiring God is named for his book Desiring God: Meditations of a Christian Hedonist (1986).

In 1980, after what he described as an "irresistible call of the Lord to preach", Piper became Pastor of Bethlehem Baptist Church in Minneapolis, Minnesota, where he has been ministering ever since. Piper hit the evangelical scene after the publication of his book Desiring God: Meditations of a Christian Hedonist (1986) and has continued to publish dozens of other books further articulating this theological perspective. In 1994, he founded Desiring God Ministries, which provides all of Piper's sermons and articles from the past three decades, and most of his books online free of charge, as well as offering for sale books, CDs, and DVDs and regularly hosting conferences.
